Today we're beginning the 2nd Session of the 116th Congress. House Democrats passed over 400 bills in '19 that will help working families provide more affordable health care and protect retirees. I'm committed to keeping the moment going into 2020 and fighting for what's right.

Lowering global carbon emissions to protect our planet for future generations shouldn't be a partisan issue. But instead of embracing green energy Donald Trump has chosen to isolate America from the rest of the world on a universally supported agreement to #CombatClimateChange.

🚨 Earlier this year I introduced the #ButchLewisAct to protect multiemployer pension plans for 1.3 million US workers. This week the bill passed the House. I will never stop fighting to help working men and women whose pensions are on the line.

Love doesn't discriminate - neither should our tax code. For years I've championed the #PRIDEAct and as Chair of Ways & Means I'm proud that this bill will soon pass the House & be a step closer to allowing married LGBTQ+ couples to get tax refunds based on their marital status.
This legislation provides an important economic boost for middle-class families who continue to struggle in this economy.  https://t.co/sVeBEd3Ug0
